definitions: A heap of things laid or lying one on top of another.
A large, imposing building or group of buildings.
A long, heavy timber or section of concrete, steel, etc., driven into the ground to support a foundation.
The soft, velvety surface of a fabric, consisting of a dense mass of upright threads or fibres.
examples: He made a pile of money.
The old pile stood on the hill.
The bridge was supported by concrete piles.
The carpet had a deep pile.
